item.title: Report E-2024010118
item.description:
Report E-2024010118

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-06
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a release from 24 boxes of UN1824 Mechanical Warewash Detergent each containing 1.5-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to complete spill cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2.5-gallons of product released in total to a 6’ x 12’ area of the trailer floor due to load shift/improper loading. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All impacted absorbents were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged boxes of product were placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD WET. ONE OF THE CONTENTS LEAKED THROUGH ITS VENTED CAP WHEN PKG WAS NOT LOADED CORRECTLY. SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. DescribePack: ONE OF THE CONTENTS LEAKED THROUGH ITS VENTED CAP WHEN PKG WAS NOT LOADED CORRECTLY. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment was wet on one of the external box upper corners and removed from the sort stream. There was a chemical odor noted at time of discovery. The shipment was placed into a plastic lined container for inspection. DescribePack: One of the bottles of nail polish was broken in half inside the external packaging. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up by application of absorbent materials. The rest of the shipment was placed into a plastic lined container.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by management to contain the leakage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet. The package was placed in a Hazmat Bag and inside of a Hazmat tote. DescribePack: The lid of a gallon of Eco-Lye Scale Removed was found with a loose cap. Spilled inside package causing the fiberboard box to get wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The items were placed in a Hazmat bag and Hazmat tote. The cap was then tightened and then transferred to a Hazmat Drum.

item.title: Report X-2024010255
item.description:
Report X-2024010255

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When the package was found wet by a manager, QA was contacted to inspect and move the package. The package was picked up by QA with a hazmat tote and taken to the Hazmat Cage to inspect. The item inside had a very small amount of liquid spill and when the closure was inspected it was not loose but, still leaking. DescribePack: The lid leaked even when closed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The spill was contained by the the outer box and gloves were used to move the package into a hazmat tote to prevent any more leaking.

item.title: Report X-2023120517
item.description:
Report X-2023120517

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T00:34:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: BARSTOW
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: GATX 82116 was found in the Barstow yard leaking from the top of the car. Upon inspection by a BNSF responder, the liquid valve was leaking below the valve due to being less than tool-tight.. The valve was removed, threads taped and tool-tightened.
